elements.text:
This section is for information only. There is nothing for you to complete.



Lumpectomy or Breast Conserving Surgery
  • A lumpectomy removes only the tumor itself with some surrounding breast tissue.
  • Survival rates of lumpectomy is the same as mastectomy.
  • I may need radiation therapy after my surgery.
  • Most patients go home the same day.
  • Possible risks include:
    • Needing to have more tissue removed or a mastectomy â€“ This might be the case if there are cancer cells at the edge of the tissue that was removed.
    • Collection of fluid or blood under the skin
    • Infection
    • Pain
    • Recurrent breast cancer
